MACRANDRD(8) System Manager's Manual MACRANDRD(8)

NAME

macrandrd - OpenBSD MAC address randomization daemon.

SYNOPSIS

macrandrd [-vDcd] [-v] version [-u] usage [-D] daemon mode [-c] Change MAC addresses randomly.

DESCRIPTION

macrandrd id a tiny OpenBSD MAC address randomization daemon. macrandrd modifies MAC address of every active network interface in the system except for the following interfaces: lo0 enc0 pflog0.

OPTIONS

-D
Daemon mode. Use rcctl(8) instead.
-c
Change randomly MAC addresses.
-v
Information version.
-d
Change randomly MAC addresses. Debug mode.

EXAMPLE

$doas rcctl enable macrandrd

$doas rcctl start macrandrd

SEE ALSO

rcctl(8)

AUTHORS

macrandrd was written by Giacomo Picchiarelli <gpicchiarelli@gmail.com>
August 8, 2019 OpenBSD-6.5
